result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie L. McGeshick

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:18 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Stephanie L. McGeshick appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has contacted PD Office and does qualify. Def. is waiting for paperwork and is currently on a probation hold.  Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits for P.H. Def. confirms and waives time limits. Court accepts waiver of time limits and finds good cause. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of controlled substances.

1:38 PM Defendant Stephanie L. McGeshick appeared by video.  Attorney Kelly Hays appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. All parties via Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed atty. or represent self. ADA makes cash bail bond recommendation of $3,000 with conditions of no use or possession of controlled substances. Def. responds. The Court makes statement and findings. The Court orders a cash bail bond of $3,000 with conditions of no use or possession of controlled substances. Adjourned initial appearance is scheduled on October 10, 2022 at 1:30 PM. Court recess at 1:45 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
